Title: Bulbrite Solana Smart Filament Light Bulb Review: See the light
Author: Christopher Close
Description: The Solana line of smart bulbs combine vintage charm with modern conveniences such as app and voice control.
Bottom Line: Bulbrite's Solana line offers excellent looks and convenient controls all at an affordable price. If you are in the market for a stylish alternative to the traditional smart bulb and don't mind missing out on HomeKit, then the Solana bulbs should definitely be on your radar.

Title: ConnectSense Smart In-Wall Outlet Review: Clean convenience
Author: Christopher Close
Description: The ConnectSense Smart In-Wall Outlet offers all of the convenience of a smart plug, without the ugly bulk.
Bottom Line: The ConnectSense Smart In-Wall Outlet offers all of the connected goodies as standard smart plugs, without the added bulk. Fast response times, reliable connectivity, and energy monitoring make it a great option for those that want convenience, but don't want to compromise on design.

Title: Waterfield Boot Camp Gym Bag review: Just right-sized
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Waterfield's Boot Camp Gym Bag is just the right size for your gym essentials and fits inside most lockers. Plus, it looks so good, you might just be more excited than usual to get to the gym.
Bottom Line: This thoughtfully-designed bag is perfect for the gym and much more.

Title: Marseille mClassic review: Improved anti-aliasing for Nintendo Switch and Xbox One
Author: Asher Madan
Description: A few weeks ago, a device called the Marseille mClassic arrived at my doorstep. The company advertises it as the "world's first add-on graphics processor" for consoles, and it's supposed to dramatically enhance titles being displayed in 4K. Read this review to learn more.
Bottom Line: If you game regularly on a 4K TV and use a Nintendo Switch or Xbox One, then I would recommend picking up the Marseille mClassic because it'll boost the image quality of sub-1080p games.

Title: Picaso Lab Classic Plus MacBook Case review: Hand-crafted leather
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Sure, you can pop your MacBook into a cheap sleeve to protect it on the go, but perhaps it's time to upgrade to something more luxurious.
Bottom Line: This hand-crafted premium leather case protects your MacBook beautifully.

Title: Affinity Publisher Review: The best dang desktop publishing app around
Author: Jeffery Battersby
Description: For page layout perfection, built to be easy and effective, Affinity Publisher has my vote.
Bottom Line: This desktop publishing program is the cherry on top of the entire Affinity trio and a must-have for self-publishers.

Title: Clutch Charger review: Ultra portable power in a pinch
Author: Christine Chan
Description: What's slim enough to fit in your wallet but also packs in 2300mAh of power? The super handy Clutch Charger!
Bottom Line: : The Clutch Charger may only pack in 2300mAh of power, but what it lacks in capacity it makes up for in convenience. It's super thin at only .15-inches, so it can fit into most wallets without an issue. It also has a built-in charging cable within the metal encasing.

Title: Schlage Sense Smart Deadbolt Review: Sleek, smart, and secure
Author: Christopher Close
Description: This smart deadbolt from Schlage is easy to install, works with HomeKit out of the box, and has a clean modern design.
Bottom Line: The Schlage Sense is an easy to install, reliable, HomeKit connected deadbolt that also happens to have a gorgeous keypad design. Even though Alexa and Google Assistant require a separate Wi-Fi adapter, the Sense is still one of the best deadbolts around.

Title: Nexar Beam Dash Cam review: Simple and accessible dash cam for everyone
Author: Christine Chan
Description: The Nexar Beam is a small and discreet dash cam that connects with your phone, allowing you to view footage anywhere. Is this investment worth your time? Absolutely.
Bottom Line: : The Nexar Beam is small and compact enough to fit inconspicuously behind your rearview mirror. It only takes five minutes to set up and has crisp and clear 1080p HD video recording with a super wide-angle field of view. It connects to your iPhone (or Android) and has unlimited Nexar Cloud storage, allowing you to view your footage anywhere conveniently.

Title: Clockwork Synergy Seat Belt NATO Apple Watch Band review: Durable good looks
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Have you been searching for an Apple Watch band that can stand up to your many adventures but look good doing it? Check out the latest band from Clockwork Synergy.
Bottom Line: This Apple Watch band made from seat belt fabric looks sharp and wears tough.

Title: PhoneSoap Pro review: Killing germs on your iPhone has never been easier
Author: Bryan M Wolfe
Description: Unfortunately, our iPhones are cesspools of bacteria. To kill 99.99 percent of germs on your device, consider the PhoneSoap Pro.

Title: Novostella Smart LED Floodlight Review: Flooded with light
Author: Christopher Close
Description: The Novostella Smart LED Floodlight brings bright, colorful lighting to the great outdoors.
Bottom Line: The Novostella Smart LED Floodlight brings bright, colorful lighting to the great outdoors with an IP66 weather resistance rating. However, the clunky stand design and pairing process hinder the overall experience.

Title: SENA Wallet Book Case review: Protect your valuables beautifully
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: This gorgeous case holds your iPhone as well as up to three cards plus cash securely.
Bottom Line: This genuine leather case secures your iPhone as well as up to three cards plus cash.

Title: Pad & Quill Leather Laptop Tote review: Professional style
Author: Christine Chan
Description: One of Pad & Quill's more recent offerings is the new Leather Laptop Tote. It's gorgeous and high quality, but not without flaws.
Bottom Line: : The Leather Laptop Tote is a gorgeous bag that's made from high quality, American full-grade leather with herringbone lining and UV resistant nylon stitching. It has plenty of pockets and space for your necessities, including a padded compartment for a laptop up to 13-inches, and zips shut to keep everything secure.

Title: Pokémon HOME review: If you seriously want to trade, you'll need to pay for the premium plan
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: If you're a Pokémon fan, you're likely considering creating a Pokémon HOME account. While it isn't the most intuitive service, it does provide several helpful features.
Bottom Line: : While there is a free version, you're going to have to pay for the premium subscription if you really want to use this service. The transferring process is a little clunky and limited, however trading with others online makes it worth it.

Title: RoomMe Personal Location Sensor Review: Automation from above
Author: Christopher Close
Description: RoomMe's Personal Location Sensor works with your phone to set the scene when entering, or leaving, a room.
Bottom Line: The RoomMe PLS provides personalized automations that activate quickly upon entering a room with your connected smartphone. However, limited HomeKit support, and reliance on having your phone in hand keeps it from being a must-have accessory.

Title: Goldenerre Classic Link Bracelet for Apple Watch review: Gorgeous jewelry band
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Who says the Apple Watch has to have a band that looks like, well, a watch band? Goldenerre takes the link bracelet to the next level with this elegant bracelet band.
Bottom Line: I'm in love with this link bracelet, which is more jewelry than Apple Watch band.

Title: Roborock S5 Max review: My life is definitely better with Robbie in it
Author: Lory Gil
Description: After to many failed attempts at using a robot vacuum, I'd just about given up ... until I met the Roborock S5 Max.
Bottom Line: If the conditions in your house are right, this little robot is your new bestie.

Title: Lutron Caséta Wireless Motion Sensor Review: Smart and speedy
Author: Christopher Close
Description: The Caséta Wireless Smart Motion Sensor is crazy fast, reliable, and extremely easy to set up.
Bottom Line: The Caséta Wireless Motion Sensor features extremely fast response times, high reliability, and is quite easy to set up. This combined with 10-year battery life, and multiple mounting options, make this sensor one of the best around.

Title: IINA Review: A Top-Shelf Video Player Made for Mac
Author: Nathan Alderman
Description: One video-viewing app to rule them all.
Bottom Line: IINA does almost everything you want a video player on Mac to do except make your popcorn for you, all with an Apple aesthetic design.

Title: Wearlizer Stainless Steel and Resin Apple Watch Band review: Classic chic
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Wearlizer's Stainless Steel and Resin Apple Watch Band looks like a classic link bracelet watch band, but the blend of colors and materials gives it a chic, modern look. The reasonable price tag may surprise you.
Bottom Line: It's a classic link watchband with a modern twist for your Apple Watch that won't break the bank.

Title: Abode iota Security Kit Review: Security without a subscription
Author: Christopher Close
Description: The Abode iota Security Kit is a HomeKit compatible alarm system that keeps an eye on your home, without requiring a subscription.
Bottom Line: The Abode iota Security Kit provides a solid foundation for a DIY whole home security system, without requiring yet another subscription. Fast response times, HomeKit integration, and seemingly endless expandability combine with an affordable price to make the iota one of the best alarm systems around.

Title: Puzzle & Dragons GOLD for Nintendo Switch review: A frustrating experience you're better without
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: Curious about how the Nintendo Switch version of Puzzle & Dragon holds up to the Smartphone version? It's not nearly as good.
Bottom Line: : The puzzles themselves could be fun, but they're bogged down by a sloppy plot and horrible turn-based mechanics. This isn't a worthwhile purchase for most Switch gamers.

Title: SpellTower Plus review: A classic reimagined for today
Author: Christine Chan
Description: SpellTower is a classic word game that came out back in 2011 and is beloved by many. And now it's back and better than ever in SpellTower Plus.
Bottom Line: : SpellTower+ is a great successor to a classic iOS word game. It adds five brand new modes, some new game mechanics, iCloud backup, new daily challenges, and more.

Title: VirtualBox for Mac review: Unpolished virtualization that's not for everyone
Author: Bryan M Wolfe
Description: Open-source VirtualBox isn't for most people. However, it has just enough perks that open it up to consideration.
Bottom Line: Open-source, free for personal and educational use

Title: HORI Split Pad Pro for Nintendo Switch review: The best way to play in handheld mode
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: I tested the HORI Split Pad Pro for over 20 hours to see how well it worked with the Nintendo Switch. You're definitely gonna want to use these.
Bottom Line: : It's kind of expensive, but definitely worth it for a better handheld experience. These give you a D-pad, extra back buttons, Turbo buttons, and reduce hand strain when using your Switch.

Title: Cadenshae Maternity & Nursing Activewear Review: An active mom's dream!
Author: Nicolette Roux
Description: Looking for some cute new activewear Mama? Check out Cadenshae, stylish nursing and maternity wear for the mom on the go!
Bottom Line: : Cadenshae is an excellent activewear line for moms pre and postpartum. They offer a wide selection of maternity and nursing apparel and were founded by a mommy/daddy duo. Their clothes are stylish, comfortable, convenient, thoughtfully designed, and well made.

Title: WaterField Mezzo Laptop Backpack review: Perfectly mid-sized
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: The WaterField Mezzo Laptop Backpack is, as its name implies, mid-sized. It's perfect for the commuter or traveler, with padded pockets for your laptop and tablet, as well as other convenient features.
Bottom Line: Carry your laptop, tablet, and other essentials in this mid-sized luxury bag.

Title: Fantastical 3 review: You can throw all your other calendar apps in the trash
Author: Lory Gil
Description: Fantastical already did pretty much everything I ever need a calendar app to do. Now it does things I never knew I wanted, but now I can't live without.
Bottom Line: With this update, Fantastical basically has it all. And with a premium subscription, you'll also always get the updates even if it doesn't currently have everything you need.

Title: Wearlizer Thin Leather Apple Watch Band review: Excellent price and quality
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Treat your Apple Watch to a tapered leather band that won't break the bank. The quality is excellent and you'll find a huge selection of colors and patterns.
Bottom Line: Elevate your Apple Watch style with this high-quality leather band that won't break the bank.

Title: HyperX ChargePlay Clutch Charging Case for Nintendo Switch review: Play your games longer with this awesome accessory
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: The Nintendo Switch is an awesome console. But, if you find it's running out of power too quickly you should consider picking up the HyperX ChargePlay Clutch portable battery charger.
Bottom Line: : It's a bit expensive and it makes your Switch bulkier, but it provides extra battery life and much better grip than the console has on its own. It's a great purchase for any Switch owner.

Title: Ring Fit Adventure Review three months later: How a video game made me less lazy
Author: Lory Gil
Description: I went from less than 3,000 steps per day to having a personal trainer and I owe it all to a video game that teaches you how to be active.

Title: Nomad Rugged Case for AirPods Pro review: It's the little things that make a big difference
Author: Lory Gil
Description: It may seem like nothing more than a nice leather case at first glance, but Nomad's design team makes magic happen.
Bottom Line: Though it has a simple, minimalist look, this rugged AirPods Pro case has a lot going on.

Title: Malouf M555 Hands-on: Here's how app controls and Siri work with this wild adjustable bed base
Author: Christopher Close
Description: Is this adjustable base the bed of the future? With app and Siri controls, we think so.

Title: Your kids (and maybe yourself) will love Moshi Twilight Sleep Stories
Author: Bryan M Wolfe
Description: Toddlers don't always want to go to bed at night. To make the nighttime routine easier for parents and children alike, there's the Moshi Twilight Sleep app.

Title: PuroGamer Headset for Nintendo Switch review: Awesome wired headphones that will help protect your ears
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: I tested the PuroGamer volume-limiting headset for two weeks to get a feel for how well they work. Though they don't get louder than 85 dB, they're plenty loud for most people.
Bottom Line: : While they don't get super loud, they do provide plenty of volume and crystal clear sound. The fit is a little odd and might not work well for larger players, but they're a great option overall.

Title: Wearlizer Rhinestone X-Link Apple Watch Band review: Elegant jewelry
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: This pretty rhinestone-enhanced Apple Watch bangle bracelet looks more like jewelry on your wrist than a health and fitness band.
Bottom Line: Turn your health and fitness tracker into a charming jewelry piece.

Title: Tokyo Mirage Sessions #FE Encore for Nintendo Switch review: A quirky JRPG makes an upbeat comeback
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: Tokyo Mirage Sessions #FE Encore just released for Nintendo Switch. While it's a strange idea in concept, the random mix of Fire Emblem aspects and the world of Atlus gaming make it a charming experience overall.
Bottom Line: : This game offers fun turn-based combat, a fantastical look into the world of J-Pop, and gorgeous anime cutscenes. While it has Fire Emblem elements, it plays more like Shin Megami Tensei.

Title: TwelveSouth AirSnap Pro review: Elegant protection for AirPods Pro
Author: Christine Chan
Description: TwelveSouth's new AirSnap Pro provides stylish protection for your AirPods Pro and makes carrying them more convenient than ever.
Bottom Line: : TwelveSouth's AirSnap Pro is an elegant and stylish case for the AirPods Pro made from premium top-grain leather with a metal snap enclosure. There's an opening at the bottom for easy charging and it's also wireless charging compatible, and you can use the S-clip or nylon wristlet for easy carrying.

Title: Scosche Flytunes Wireless Audio Transmitter for Nintendo Switch review: Keeps your USB-C port free while listening to Bluetooth headphones
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: One of the Nintendo Switch's biggest flaws is that it doesn't have Bluetooth capabilities. So if you want to use wireless headphones while you play, you'll need a reliable audio adapter like Flytunes.
Bottom Line: : It's a bit bulkier than other Bluetooth adapters out there, but since it uses the headphone jack instead of the USB-C port, it gives you more options when playing your Nintendo Switch. It offers really good sound quality, and is easy to use. All in all, it's a great transmitter.

Title: Philips Hue Play Bar Review: Raising the bar
Author: Christopher Close
Description: These highly versatile Hue smart lights work as accent lighting, bias lighting, or just as cool lamps. The Hue Play Bar does it all.
Bottom Line: The Philips Hue Play Bar is a versatile lighting solution that offers bright, vivid colors in a compact and light form factor. This makes the Play Bar a fantastic choice for bias and accent lighting, especially if you have other Hue lights in your home.

Title: Riverbond for Nintendo Switch review: Adorable hack-n-slash fun for everyone
Author: Christine Chan
Description: Riverbond may look bright and cheery, but it's a challenging shoot-and-slash dungeon crawler that's fun for everyone, but there are some caveats.
Bottom Line: : Riverbond is a simple shoot-n-slash dungeon crawler for the entire family. It's not too challenging or very in-depth, making it best geared for younger or casual gamers.

Title: Microsoft Edge on Mac review: in time, a worthy Safari competitor
Author: Bryan M Wolfe
Description: Web browsers are an important part of everyday life. However, when was the last time you switched browsers? It might be time to make a switch thanks to Microsoft Edge.
Bottom Line: : Free download.

Title: Sega Genesis Mini review: A great retro replica for veteran and beginning players
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: The Sega Genesis Mini gives you 42 classic games to enjoy. It's an awesome console for new and veteran gamers alike.
Bottom Line: : The Sega Genesis Mini is a great buy for nostalgic and novice players alike. It comes with 42 classic Sega games including Sonic the Hedgehog and Street Fighter 2. You can create save points for any game and it comes with two controllers so you can play the multiplayer games with a buddy.

Title: ERGO K860 Split Ergonomic Keyboard review: Comfort at any angle
Author: Lory Gil
Description: How a keyboard can help your posture, not just your wrist movement.

Title: Adidas Originals iPhone 11 case: a surprising tribute to a legacy
Author: Joe Wituschek
Description: Adidas has dropped a new line of cases for the iPhone 11 and iPhone 11 Pro, and they've brought sneaker culture to your hand.
Bottom Line: Adidas is bringing history to the present in a stylish and impressively built way.

Title: Best Western Digital External Hard Drives in 2020
Author: Camille Sanghera
Description: Wondering what the best external hard drives are from Western Digital? We've made it easy and broken it down for you.

Title: PDP Afterglow Wireless Deluxe Controller for Nintendo Switch: An awesome alternative to the Pro Controller
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: The PDP Afterglow Wireless Deluxe Controller for Nintendo Switch is a great alternative to the more expensive Pro Controller. Any Switch owner would be happy to have it.
Bottom Line: : It costs less than the Pro Controller but feels just as hefty. The extra buttons on the backside are wonderful as they are designed in such a way that they aren't intrusive when you're playing. You can have the controller cycle through colors or choose a specific color to stay on. This is a great option to have as it looks gorgeous, is easy to program, and runs for long stretches between charges.

Title: The Chipolo ONE review: New item tracker competes well with Tile, but beware of Apple
Author: Bryan M Wolfe
Description: The latest item tracker from Chipolo is inexpensive and packed with features. Still, it might not be for you.
Bottom Line: : $25 each, discounted when you buy extra

Title: Retro Review: 2009 Mac Pro in 2020
Author: Anthony Casella
Description: Thinking of upgrading to the iMac Pro? Perhaps an old Mac Pro can still suit you in 2020.

Title: Cover-Up MacBook Skin review: Real wood or stone for a unique style
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: You're not one to settle for "the usual" look for your MacBook. Cover-Up has you covered, with a genuine wood or stone MacBook skin.
Bottom Line: Cover-Up uses genuine wood or stone to craft unique MacBook skins by hand.

Title: Otter + Pop Figura Series iPhone Case review: Sleeker PopGrip option
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: OtterBox cases are known for having excellent smartphone protection, and PopSockets PopGrips are known for giving you a secure grip on your phone. The two companies have collaborated on several cases, and the latest is the slim and trim Figura Series.
Bottom Line: This lightweight but protective case has a built-in PopGrip for a secure grip on your phone.

Title: Casery London Travel Backpack review: Carry your tech in style
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Casery's London Travel Backpack is both stylish and functional. It holds your laptop and has room for your other essentials whether you are traveling to the office or around the globe.
Bottom Line: This laptop backpack is beautiful and functional but feels rather stiff and heavy.

Title: Mimeo Photos Review: Extend your Photos app abilities
Author: Jeffery Battersby
Description: Mimeo is a Photo project extension that lets you create your own fun and custom photo projects right on your Mac.
Bottom Line: Free to download

Title: TV+ vs. Disney+ review: One season later
Author: Rene Ritchie
Description: Both Apple and Disney announced new streaming video services this year and they couldn’t have been more different.

Title: Lanmodo Vast Car Night Vision Camera review: Clearly capable
Author: Christopher Close
Description: Drive a lot at night, and often worry about the dangers that could strike from out of nowhere? Then this camera might be the solution for you.
Bottom Line: The Lanmodo Vast improves visibility in dark or low light settings, potentially avoiding dangerous situations. However, its high price tag and average build quality keep it from being a must have for everyone.

Title: Apollo Max Power Bank review: The fastest battery pack to recharge your iPhone 11 Pro and everything else
Author: Christine Chan
Description: Ever hear of a power bank that can recharge itself from empty to full in 19 minutes flat? That's what Elecjet claims with the Apollo Max, and it's no lie — this battery pack will recharge everything with 60W USB-C PD output!
Bottom Line: : The Apollo Max Power Bank may only have a 10000mAh capacity, but it features 60W USB-C Power Delivery output to quickly charge up your iPhone 11 Pro, iPad Pro, MacBook, and anything else. It also has an 18W Quick Charge 3.0 USB-A port, so all of your bases are covered.

Title: Apple Watch — Gadget of the Decade
Author: Rene Ritchie
Description: In my Apple Watch Series 5 review, I said that the addition of always-on took it from being the best smartwatch in the world to being the best damn watch period. And, three months later, I stand by that. Absolutely. 100 percent. But, it's also something more: Not just the best watch of the year, but the best gadget of the decade.

Title: eufyCam2 review: No wires, no subscription
Author: Christopher Close
Description: This wireless camera system has all of the bells and whistles, including HomeKit, along with a price tag that won't break the bank.
Bottom Line: The eufyCam 2 is an affordable, completely wireless option that is packed full of features. Excellent battery life, weather resistance, 1080p video resolution, 2-way audio, and more make this a standout that doesn't require a monthly subscription.

Title: Aqara Smart Home System review: Control everything for much less
Author: Bryan M Wolfe
Description: If you're looking for an all-in-one smart home solution, consider the new Aqara system, which is now available through Amazon. Use it to monitor your home and so much more.
Bottom Line: : $130 for the starter kit

Title: Woolnut Leather Folio for MacBook review: Luxurious protection
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Your MacBook Pro or MacBook Air will be snug in this cozy and classy folio. With its vegetable-tanned full-grain Scandinavian leather exterior and soft natural wool interior, your MacBook will be protected in elegant style.
Bottom Line: This slim, elegant zip-around MacBook case is crafted from premium leather and wool.

Title: 'Truth Be Told' Review for Apple TV+: Compelling subject matter that flounders in too many unimportant details
Author: Luke Filipowicz
Description: Modern culture is obsessed with true crime. From podcasts like Serial, TV shows like Making a Murderer, and films like Extremely Wicked, Shockingly Evil and Vile, we are obsessed with the macabre in a way that we never have been before. We also love an underdog story — so Truth Be Told should be a gold mine.

Title: The ibi smart photo and video manager review: Time to ditch iCloud?
Author: Bryan M Wolfe
Description: If you want to ditch iCloud or another online photo and video backup service, you should consider SanDisk's ibi smart photo and video manager. The device works as expected and includes lots of sharing tools too.
Bottom Line: : $130 for 1TB

Title: Mujjo Insulated Touchscreen Gloves review: Better but less unique
Author: Lory Gil
Description: This is the third iteration of Mujjo's best-selling gloves and they've fixed the one flaw but removes a great feature.
Bottom Line: Full-palm capacity, a better fit, a warmer glove, and that thumb stitch issue fixed. These are the only winter gloves you'll ever need.

Title: Native Union Clic Marquetry iPhone Case review: Chic leather style
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: It's not enough just to protect your iPhone from life's little bumps, you want to give it some panache as well. The Native Union Clic Marquetry iPhone Case will be right up your alley.
Bottom Line: This slim leather case adds a distinctively chic look to your iPhone.

Title: mophie juice pack access for iPhone 11 Pro review: extend the battery life of your already extended battery life
Author: Lory Gil
Description: You thought the iPhone 11 Pro's battery life was good, but wait till you add a juice pack access to it!

Title: Visible phone service review: Enjoy the Verizon Network for less
Author: Bryan M Wolfe
Description: If you think you're overpaying for Verizon's wireless service, but still want to use the Verizon network, switch to Visible. You'll save lots of cash while still reaping the benefits.
Bottom Line: : $40 per month

Title: Clockwork Synergy Canvas Apple Watch Band review: Smart casual
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Looking for a comfortable watch band that straddles the line between dressy and casual? Check out Clockwork Synergy's Canvas Bands for Apple Watch.
Bottom Line: This comfortable Apple Watch band is a just-right style that can be dressed up or down.

Title: Apple Smart Battery Case for iPhone 11 Pro review: Snap away with juice for days
Author: Christine Chan
Description: Apple's Smart Battery Case may provide you with more battery life, but we're more impressed with that dedicated camera button.
Bottom Line: : Apple's Smart Battery Case for iPhone 11 Pro provides you with about 50 percent more battery life than the phone itself (depending on your usage factors), and it has a new dedicated camera button. The camera button has a slight curved groove to it, making it easy to feel for it on the bottom right edge, and it makes it easier and faster to get to the camera.

Title: 'Servant' Review for Apple TV+: A superb atmospheric thriller that's a joy to watch
Author: Luke Filipowicz
Description: Apple TV+ has dipped its toe into the thriller/horror genre with Servant, and while it isn't completely flawless, it has kept me on the edge of my seat.

Title: Totallee Wireless Car Charger review: Charge conveniently
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Totallee's Wireless Car Charger serves both as a secure car mount and a wireless charger for your iPhone or any other Qi-enabled smartphone. It opens and closes automatically or with a gentle tap.
Bottom Line: This vent mount for your phone holds it securely and charges it wirelessly.

Title: Autonomous SmartDesk 2 review: Luxury standing desk at a budget price
Author: Lory Gil
Description: The SmartDesk 2 makes working all day long a lot more comfortable. Check out our review.
Bottom Line: The SmartDesk 2 is quality made, whisper-quiet, and fits within the range of reasonably priced standing desk options.

Title: LAUT Pearl Series for iPhone review: Slim, tough, and fashion-forward
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: LAUT's Pearl Series cases look three-dimensional but are totally smooth to the touch. While this case is not the most heavy-duty case you can buy, nor the slimmest, it strikes a nice balance between them resulting in a trim but protective case.
Bottom Line: You'll love gazing upon this lightweight but protective case.

Title: Apple Arcade just feels right with a PlayStation 4 DualShock 4 controller
Author: Christine Chan
Description: How is Apple Arcade with a DualShock 4 controller? It's surprisingly great, and well worth getting an extra DualShock 4 or two if you want to take your Apple Arcade games to the next level.

Title: Casery Convertible Fanny Pack review: On trend
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: iPhone holsters are convenient, but not exactly fashionable, especially for women. Casery offers an excellent alternative.
Bottom Line: This vegan leather bag serves as a more fashion-forward alternative to the phone holster.

Title: 16-inch MacBook Pro Review: 2 weeks later
Author: Rene Ritchie
Description: I've been using the 16-inch MacBook Pro day in, day out, as my main computational machine, since just before Apple announced it. I've done all the emails and messages, surfed all the websites, watched all the TV, written tens of thousands of words, and edited 7 or so YouTube videos comprising about an hour of a-roll and just a ton of b-roll. In other words, I've hammered on it. And...

Title: Shutterfly Photo Printing review: Quality, variety, and value
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: I've been using Shutterfly to store and print my photos for the better part of a decade. Here's why.
Bottom Line: : varies

Title: LG UltraFine 4K Display review: Two screens for the price of one
Author: Lory Gil
Description: If you're looking for an UltraFine alternative to the $1,200 5K 27-inch model Apple used to sell, the UltraFine 4K is slightly smaller, has plenty of Ks, and costs about half as much.

Title: Fitbit Versa 2 review: Time lapse
Author: Daniel Bader
Description: The Fitbit Versa 2 is a decent if underwhelming upgrade to one of the best fitness trackers on the market today.

Title: iPhone 11 Smart Battery Case Review
Author: Rene Ritchie
Description: The iPhone 11, iPhone 11 Pro, and iPhone 11 Pro Max Smart Battery Cases are here! Obviously, they change up the camera bump cutout, but they also add a new, dedicated, hardware camera button to launch the camera app and take photos and QuickVideo.

Title: Walmart Photo Printing review: An inexpensive option
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Walmart delivers good quality products for a low price. But creating a photo book can be quite frustrating.
Bottom Line: : Varies

Title: Google Pixel 4 Review: From an iPhone user's perspective
Author: Rene Ritchie
Description: I’ve been using Google’s Pixel 4 phone for four weeks now. I mean, really using it. With my SIM card in it and everything. Taking photos. Making calls. Playing Pokemon Go. And here's my review, from an iPhone-users perspective... one month later.

Title: UAG Civilian Series iPhone Case review: Shock-absorbing and sophisticated
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Urban Armor Gear, or UAG, has released a sharp-looking new case. It's feather-light but is designed to absorb and disperse shocks in case you drop your precious iPhone.
Bottom Line: This non-bulky but rugged case protects your iPhone and looks good doing it.

Title: Waterfield Air Duffel Carry-On Bag review: Just right-sized
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Waterfield's Air Duffel Carry-On Bag is perfectly sized to fit under the seat on most airlines, so it can count as your personal bag rather than a carry-on. Yet, you can pack a lot into this small duffel bag, making it ideal for air travel.
Bottom Line: Travel light and stylish with this efficiently-designed luxury bag as your personal item.

Title: PhoneSoap 3 review: Kills the germs, leaves the smudges
Author: Lory Gil
Description: If you're concerned about bacteria and germs, you need this UV-C lightbox to clean your phone. {

Title: Fangamer Flip Grip for Nintendo Switch review: The best way to play retro arcade and pinball games
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: Do you ever wish you could play some of those sweet retro games vertically on your Nintendo Switch? This is the accessory that makes it a heck of a lot easier to do. Of course, the game has to be compatible with vertical orientation for this to work.
Bottom Line: : This Switch accessory is the best way to enjoy games that work in vertical mode. It's sturdy, looks good, and doesn't cost very much. You'll just need to make sure that the game you want to use it with works in the proper orientation.

Title: Pokémon Sword and Shield for Nintendo Switch review: Not as innovative as hoped, but still fun to play
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: Pokémon Sword and Shield definitely won't be game of the year, but they're still fun games for people to play.
Bottom Line: : Pokémon Sword and Shield offer awesome new Pokémon for you to discover and a beautifully designed, U.K.-inspired world to explore. These games don't offer a lot of new elements, with familiar gameplay and a short storyline. However, these games still provide a fun, lighthearted experience for players of all ages.

Title: 'For All Mankind' review: Blasting off into an exciting alternate history
Author: Joseph Keller
Description: It takes its time, but For All Mankind achieves liftoff to show us an exciting alternate history.

Title: AirPods Pro Takes Accessible Earbuds to the Next Level
Author: Steven Aquino
Description: I've been testing AirPods Pro for a couple of weeks now and can say with conviction that I love them.

Title: Photoshop for iPad review: The industry standard image editor gets a reboot
Author: Marc Edwards
Description: Adobe has fulfilled its 2018 promise, bringing a new version of Photoshop to the iPad. Does it live up to the legacy?
Bottom Line: It's not as robust as you may have originally hoped for, but Adobe has made good on what it promised.

Title: Hex 4-in-1 iPhone Case review: Flexible protection
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: The Hex 4-in-1 iPhone Case is a rugged case plus an RFID-blocking card wallet plus a folio. You can mix and match the pieces in various ways, depending on what functionality you need on a given day.
Bottom Line: Mix and match the rugged case, folio, and RFID-blocking card wallet to your specifications.

Title: A Better Finder Rename 11 review: Image renaming software that everyone should have
Author: Jeffery Battersby
Description: If you rename a lot of files on a regular basis, this bulk automation tool will make the lazy in you very happy.
Bottom Line: If you rename a lot of files on a regular basis, this bulk automation tool will make the lazy in you very happy.

Title: Tom Bihn Synik 22 review: My new everyday carry backpack
Author: Christine Chan
Description: The Tom Bihn Synik backpack is now available. Think of it as an upgrade to the original Synapse. Is it worth the money?
Bottom Line: : Synik is an upgraded Synapse backpack, now with a full clamshell style design that makes it easier to pack like a suitcase. Your laptop is safe and secure in the suspended compartment with two points of access. The straps are comfortable, there are plenty of pockets for your stuff, and it the chunky, premium YKK zippers are heavy-duty.

Title: Moshi Avanti C headphones review: affordable comfort if you still like wired cans
Author: Bryan M Wolfe
Description: Moshi Avanti C headphones are one of those rare audio products that weren't designed to pair with Apple's iPhone. Despite this, don't rule them out if you're in the market for a comfortable pair of wired, on-ear headphones.
Bottom Line: Beautifully designed and available in different colors, Moshi Avanti C is a forward-looking choice for those looking for a USB-C audio solution.

Title: AirFly Pro review: A Bluetooth transmitter that deserves the 'pro' name
Author: Lory Gil
Description: What's better than a Bluetooth transmitter? A Bluetooth transmitter that works both ways!
Bottom Line: This pro version of a Bluetooth transmitter has three features in one; Bluetooth transmitting, audio sharing, and a Bluetooth audio adapter.

Title: Pixel 4 vs. iPhone 11 video camera review
Author: Rene Ritchie
Description: I'm putting the iPhone 11 up against the Pixel 4 in a camera-to-camera video shootout. So, which optics will reign supreme?

Title: 'The Elephant Queen' review: A picture perfect adventure for the entire family
Author: Bryan M Wolfe
Description: Though it's lacking some key details, the Apple TV+ film "The Elephant Queen" works on nearly every level. It's a mostly Disney-esque adventure that's appropriate for everyone.

Title: Wearlizer Crystal Rhinestone Apple Watch Band review: Pretty and sparkly
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Embedded with hundreds of crystal rhinestones, the band adds a fun and festive touch to the rather serious-looking Apple Watch. I love wearing this band both to work and for a night out on the town.
Bottom Line: This stainless steel band full of crystal rhinestones dresses up your Apple Watch beautifully.

Title: Mario and Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 review: Go for the gold, Mario!
Author: Christine Chan
Description: Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games: Tokyo 2020 has arrived on the Nintendo Switch. Do you have what it takes to get all of the gold medals?
Bottom Line: : Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games: Tokyo 2020 is a fun game that will be enjoyed by everyone in the whole family. It features a story-driven single-player mode, Quick Match with tons of mini-games, and up to eight people can compete together through local or online multiplayer.

Title: 'Dickinson' season one for Apple TV+ review: Weird, whimsical, wild, and wonderful.
Author: Luke Filipowicz
Description: Mixing a 19th century period piece with a millennial teen dramedy didn't sound like a good idea on paper, yet I watched the entire first season of Dickinson with a smile on my face.

Title: 'The Morning Show' Review for Apple TV+: A slow and dull start, but there is future potential
Author: Luke Filipowicz
Description: The first three episodes of The Morning Show really struggle to find its footing as the script is full of needless exposition and most of the characters don't feel fully fleshed-out; however, by the end of the third episode there is a glimmer of hope for the show's future.

Title: 'Ghostwriter' review: Making literature cool again, one story at a time
Author: Bryan M Wolfe
Description: Apple TV+ brings back an old television show for kids that hopes to teach us all a little bit more about literature in a digital world.

Title: The Bradwell Conspiracy: Paranoia With a Stiff Upper Lip
Author: Nathan Alderman
Description: While it’s far from perfect, this thought-provoking first-person adventure offers a compelling mystery to unravel.

Title: 'Snoopy in Space' review: Getting kids excited about space flight again
Author: Lory Gil
Description: What would it be like if a dog manned the International Space Station?

Title: 'See' Review for Apple TV+: Off to a great start with a few stumbles along the way
Author: Luke Filipowicz
Description: The high-fantasy drama starring Jason Momoa and Alfre Woodard is an ambitious show with lots of ideas, and while it can struggle to rein them all in at times, the first three episodes have me very excited for the future of See.

Title: Running a 5K with AirPods Pro: Five questions answered
Author: Russell Holly
Description: Can AirPods Pro hold up against thousands of jostled jogging steps and sweaty ears while still providing clear, yet transparent, audio? Find out how they performed on my morning jog.

Title: Adonit Note+ Stylus review: More control than ever
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: The latest Bluetooth stylus from Adonit features pressure and tilt support plus two programmable shortcut buttons for the ultimate in customizable control.
Bottom Line: The Adonit Note+ Stylus offers pressure and tilt control plus two programmable shortcut buttons.

Title: Shinsekai: Into the Depths Is The Best Apple Arcade Game No One's Talking About
Author: Nathan Alderman
Description: This mini-masterpiece blends awe, danger, and a haunting sense of loss in a beautifully realized underwater world.

Title: Casery iPhone Case review: Cute, light, protective
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: If you're looking for an Instagram-worthy iPhone case that doesn't bulk up your phone but still protects it, look no further than a Casery iPhone Case. You'll find tons of adorable and trendy designs from which to choose.
Bottom Line: Get some decent protection, not a lot of bulk, and tons of adorable designs with Casery.

Title: AirPods Pro Hands-On — vs. AirPods 2, PowerBeats Pro
Author: Rene Ritchie
Description: Apple’s got some brand new AirPods. AirPods Pro to be specific. And, I’m not just going to give you all the details, and tell you how they compare to the regular AirPods and the PowerBeats Pro, but I’m going to unbox them and go hands-on. Right now.

Title: Lake: Coloring Books review: A coloring book experience dedicated to artists
Author: Lory Gil
Description: If you haven't already tried Lake's beautiful, meditative coloring experience, version 3.0 is a good time to start.

Title: The Witcher 3 on Nintendo Switch review: Not as easy on the eyes, but easy on the go
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: I tested the Witcher 3: Wild Hunt on Nintendo Switch for over 30 hours. The visuals aren't as pretty as what you'd find on another platform, but it's still an awesome game.
Bottom Line: : The Nintendo Switch version of The Witcher 3 exchanges high-resolution graphics for portability. It runs well on the Switch and is an amazing RPG for anyone who loves magic and fantasy. I recommend it for anyone who's looking for a quality game to play on the go.

Title: Master & Dynamic MW07 Go Review: Great price but there are other things to consider
Author: Bryan M Wolfe
Description: The recently released MW07 Go truly wireless earphones by Master & Dynamic are the latest release from the luxury audio company and are priced to "go." But don't throw your money at these ear buds yet.
Bottom Line: An excellent price for a mostly good product. However, there might be a better long-term choice out there.

Title: Loopy Case for iPhone review: Stop the drop
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: You've probably seen Loopy Cases on your Instagram feed; they're popular with bloggers and influencers for good reason. The solid finger loop on the back gives you an excellent grip, steadying and securing your iPhone for better photos and life in general.
Bottom Line: This lightweight but protective case has a sturdy loop on the back for excellent grip.

Title: BenQ PD2720U DesignVue 4K Display review: the perfect monitor for visual artists
Author: Lory Gil
Description: Buying a monitor is like buying a new coat — everyone's needs are different and no single one should try to meet them all.
Bottom Line: If you're a graphic designer, photographer, or videographer, you're going to love the variety of display modes the BenQ DesignVue has to offer.

Title: Apple Watch Series 5 Review: One month later
Author: Rene Ritchie
Description: I've been using the Apple Watch Series 3 — originally a space gray aluminum and, more recently, a brushed titanium edition — for just over a month. So, how's the titanium, the always-on display, the battery life, the on-device App Store, and all the new apps one month later? Read on!

Title: The Void: Avengers: Damage Control review: Avengers, assemble!
Author: Christine Chan
Description: The Void offers immersive virtual reality experiences, and the latest is Avengers: Damage Control. Is it worth the price of admission?

Title: Skinit Impact iPhone Case review: Custom protection
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Skinit is known primarily for its custom decals, but the company also offers some pretty great cases. Show off your love for a favorite team, school, movie, character, or theme of your choice.

Title: LifeProof FLiP Series iPhone Case review: Stashable and crashable
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: This heavy-duty case from LifeProof isn't your typical wallet-style case. While there is a wallet flap, it doesn't close over the screen like a wallet folio case.

Title: iPhone 11 Camera Review: One month later
Author: Rene Ritchie
Description: I’ve been shooting with the #iPhone11 Pro for a month now. Here’s how it compares to the iPhone 6 Plus, 6s Plus, 7 Plus, X, and XS Max in a variety of situations, how Smart HDR, Deep Fusion, and Night Mode all work, and should you upgrade for the camera?

Title: Seneo's active noise-cancelling Bluetooth headphones are on sale for $40 today
Author: John Levite
Description: Block out ambient noise with the hybrid active noise-cancelling. Get long-term comfort with protein ear cups and an easy-adjust headband. The 40mm drivers deliver powerful Hi-Fi sound. And you can use the mic to take phone calls. Lasts 30 hours.

Title: Caudabe Synthesis iPhone Case review: Translucent protection
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: A clear case is great for showing off your iPhone, both its color and its Apple logo. But if you're looking for something a bit different, the translucent matte finish of the slim, protective Caudabe Synthesis has a much more subtle effect.

Title: Spigen Liquid Crystal Glitter iPhone Case review: Extra shine
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Protect your iPhone with this simple, lightweight TPU case. It's not just a clear case, though. This one is infused with sparkly but tasteful glitter.

Title: GVIEWIN Retractable Charging Cable review: Cute and convenient
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Cable tangle is the worst, and I am always looking for solutions to neaten up my work area and streamline my travel bag. Enter the USB-A to USB-C GVIEWIN Retractable Charging Cable.

Title: macOS Catalina Review
Author: Rene Ritchie
Description: Catalina, which has been available in beta form since its introduction back in June, and which goes into general release today, is the 15th version of that operating system, of the brain that runs every modern Mac. Here is its story.

Title: Velvet Caviar iPhone Case review: Stunning and protective
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: I love a pretty case, but make no mistake: this is a sturdy, protective case to set your mind at ease. If you like having a grip on the back of your phone, you can purchase one of Velvet Caviar's ring grips to match (or contrast with) your case pattern.

Title: RemoBell S Video Doorbell Review: Small cost, big features
Author: Christopher Close
Description: This cost-effective video doorbell doesn't skimp on features, and it doesn't require a subscription.

Title: Totallee Wireless Charger review: Slim and minimal
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Totallee's wireless charger is thin and aesthetically appealing, much like Totallee's cases.

Title: Synology DS620slim Review: Rock solid small-office server in a tiny package
Author: Jeffery Battersby
Description: If you're running big server needs in an itty-bitty living space, this NAS is for you.
Bottom Line: From $450

Title: GoodNotes 5.3.3 review: Taking the best iPadOS has and making it better
Author: Lory Gil
Description: If you want to see just how amazing multitasking and multiple tabs can be on iPadOS 13, GoodNotes pushes the boundaries with its latest update.

Title: Postbox 7 review: Elite email excellence
Author: Nathan Alderman
Description: This feature-stuffed email client isn’t for everyone, but it’s packed with power, polish, and poise.

Title: Dragon Quest XI S for Nintendo Switch review: This is the best version of an already amazing game
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: Previous versions of the game are awesome, but the enhancements make this Switch version even better.
Bottom Line: : This is the best version of Dragon Quest XI. It includes new character storylines, allows you to switch between playing a 2D and 3D version of the game, and has several other small enhancements to make the gaming experience more convenient and fun.

Title: Green Chef Meal Kit review: Specialty diets welcome
Author: Philip Berne
Description: Green Chef organic meal kit boxes are the best option if you need to restrict gluten or carbs, but for most cooks the recipes don't justify the higher price
Bottom Line: : From $10 per serving

Title: Pad & Quill Bella Fino iPhone 11 Pro case review: The only wallet case you'll ever need
Author: Lory Gil
Description: A wallet is a very personal style. The Bella Fino may just be the wallet case style you're looking for.

Title: Nomad Active Rugged Case review: Water-resistant leather
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: If you love a leather case, but don't want to have to worry about getting it wet, Nomad's Active Rugged Case is a case to consider. The case is wrapped in hydrophobic leather, so it won't sustain damage if it gets wets.

Title: Ni No Kuni for Nintendo Switch review: A charming fairy tale adventure
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: The delightful return of a classic game.
Bottom Line: : This rereleased classic is a delightful adventure for any Switch owner. It showcases beautiful cut scenes from Studio Ghibli and has you exploring an imaginative fairy tale world. It's a heartwarming tale about loss, love, and friendship.

Title: Fuse Chicken GRAVITY TOUCH Wireless Charger review: Bamboo beauty
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: If you're looking for a wireless charger for your iPhone that looks great sitting out on your desk, check out this slim wireless charger featuring a bamboo charging surface and chamfered aluminum edges.

Title: SteelSeries Arctis 1 Wireless Gaming Headset review: Wireless perfection for your Nintendo Switch and beyond
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: The SteelSeries Arctis 1 Wireless Gaming Headset works with PC, PS4, Xbox One, Android phones that sport a USB-C port, and even the Nintendo Switch. It comes with a USB-C wireless transmitter, USB-A adapter cable, and a 3.5 mm audio cable to help you hook it up to each of these devices.

Title: This is the case I bought for my iPhone 11 Pro and why it's my daily protection
Author: Lory Gil
Description: It's ultra-thin all the way for me, and Totallee's case is my bliss.

Title: Coros APEX review: A smartwatch for getting off the grid
Author: Mathias Eichler
Description: Apple Watch Series 5 may be the best watch for most people, but Coros' latest smartwatch is designed for those extra long-distance runs and deep wilderness adventures.
Bottom Line: From $300

Title: Sniper Elite 3 Ultimate Edition for Nintendo Switch review: Better left in the past
Author: Jake Tucker
Description: Not every game should get a Switch re-release, and Sniper Elite 3 is the perfect example.
Bottom Line: Sniper Elite 3 isn't a bad game, and I quite enjoyed playing it before on other consoles, but the Switch just isn't a good fit, and the experience is somewhat frustrating.

Title: iPhone 8 in 2019 Review: Should anyone still buy it?
Author: Rene Ritchie
Description: Buying an iPhone 8 new, now, and in the age of iPhone 11? Even starting at $449?

Title: Contra Rogue Corps for Nintendo Switch review: A huge let down for Contra fans
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: This run and gun multiplayer tries really hard to be hilariously over the top, but it just comes off as bland and boring. You'll really want to avoid this one.
Bottom Line: : The newest entry in the Contra series isn't worth your time or money. The mechanics are bland and the game itself feels unpolished. Where it tries to be funny and over-the-top, it just comes across as pathetic and amateurish.

Title: Grip2ü Slim Grip iPhone Case review: Prevent the drop
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Have been looking for a case that gives a better grip on your iPhone while still allowing you to use a wireless charger? The Grip2ü Slim Grip iPhone Case fits the bill.

Title: Link's Awakening for Nintendo Switch review: A remarkable link to the past
Author: Sara Gitkos
Description: Link's Awakening for the Switch, does the latest remark hold up to the $60 price tag, or should you just take out your GameBoy Color and call it a day? Here's what we thought of the newest addition to the Switch library.
Bottom Line: : Link's Awakening on the Switch is a beautiful reimagining of the classic game with updated graphics, a remastered soundtrack, and new details to excite both series veterans and newcomers. Unfortunately, some frame rate problems and the underwhelming Chamber Dungeon can deter some players.

Title: Amnesia: Collection for Nintendo Switch review: Still terrifying, but at what cost?
Author: Carli Velocci
Description: The Amnesia collection gathers all three games in the series in one enticing package, but is it worth playing on the Switch?
Bottom Line: : Amnesia: Collection brings together one of the best horror games ever made with its two sequels in one complete package that you can take on the go. However, wonky controls and the lack of mod support keep this from being a must-buy, even for horror fans.

Title: Jamf Now Review: Mobile Device Management for small businesses
Author: Jeffery Battersby
Description: If you're looking for a solid MDM service, you're definitely going to want to check out Jamf Now.

Title: HEX Patrol Backpack review: Stylish and roomy functionality
Author: Christine Chan
Description: The HEX Patrol Backpack has plenty of room for your tech essentials and then some.

Title: Joule vs Instant Pot Accu Slim: Which sous vide should you buy?
Author: Amy-Mae Turner
Description: If you're weighing up the differences between the Joule sous vide wand and the Instant Pot Accu Slim we can help you decide which option you should go for.

Title: Sonos One vs. HomePod: Which should you buy?
Author: Joseph Keller
Description: When you’re looking for a smart speaker for your home, should you get the Sonos One, or the Apple HomePod?

Title: Solo Leroy Rolling Duffel review: Smooth roller
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Who says you need a big, heavy suitcase? This lightweight duffel bag meets most airplane carry-on requirements and has wheels to ease your travels.

Title: Waterfield Designs Executive Leather Messenger review: Professional practicality
Author: Christine Chan
Description: The Executive Leather Laptop Messenger is a high-quality, roomy bag that is sure to make a statement. Here's what we think of the latest bag from Waterfield Designs.

Title: MX Master 3 and MX Keys review: Professional mouse and keyboard to the extreme
Author: Lory Gil
Description: Logitech's latest update to the MX Master mouse makes it more comfortable and easy to use. The MX Keys are designed to fit perfectly with it. Here's our review.

Title: Harry Potter Wizards Unite Fan Festival 2019: Full of dragons and magic
Author: Christine Chan
Description: Niantic just held the very first Harry Potter Wizards Unite Fan Festival in Indianapolis, Indiana this weekend, and it proved to be a fantastic overall experience.

Title: Burkley Rover iPad Cover review: Get a grip on your iPad
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: There's a lot to love about this full-grain premium leather and protective polycarbonate iPad case.

Title: Amazon Meal Kit review: Wilting expectations
Author: Philip Berne
Description: Amazon Meal Kits are now available at Whole Foods, but they don't live up to Whole Foods quality standards nor taste as good as better delivery kits
Bottom Line: : From $8 per serving

Title: Enter the Gungeon: Deluxe Edition for Nintendo Switch review: A ridiculously fun test of skill for one or two players
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: In addition to providing excellent randomized dungeon crawls for those who love proving their gaming skills, this game is simply downright funny to play either by yourself or with a friend.
Bottom Line: This is a super fun game for anyone who loves dungeon crawlers and has a good sense of humor. The characters are quirky and the dialogue hilarious. Challenge yourself to see if you can address the regrets of the four protagonists and set their minds at peace while blasting your way from one randomly generated dungeon after another.

Title: Zagg Rugged Messenger for iPad Air Review: Protective and functional
Author: Jared DiPane
Description: A keyboard case has proven to make me more productive on my iPad, and the Zagg Rugged Messenger has quickly become my favorite option.

Title: Yu-Gi-Oh! Legacy of the Duelist: Link Evolution review: It's time to duel!
Author: Christine Chan
Description: Yu-Gi-Oh! Legacy of the Duelist: Link Evolution has finally arrived on the Nintendo Switch, and we are reliving the glory days of iconic duels between Yami Yugi and Seto Kaiba.
Bottom Line: Yu-Gi-Oh! Legacy of the Duelist: Link Evolution is the perfect way to get your Yu-Gi-Oh! fix on-the-go. Relive iconic duels from all seasons of the anime series, take part in reverse duels, duel against friends in multiplayer, play in Sealed and Draft Battles, earn card rewards, and unlock over 9000 cards from booster packs. It's all Yu-Gi-Oh!, all the time.

Title: Mosyle Business review—Cloud-based Mobile Device Management at a great price
Author: Jeffery Battersby
Description: Cloud-based mobile device management service offers excellent features at an unbeatable price.
Bottom Line: $12 per device per year

Title: Journal for iPad Pro review: An executive look when you want to impress
Author: Lory Gil
Description: With the Journal folio case now available for the iPad Pro, you can have the Apple device equivalent of matched luggage.
Bottom Line: From $100

Title: Apple Card review: How a credit card can actually be different
Author: Lory Gil
Description: Though the act of using it isn't any different than any other credit card, the Apple Card experience is completely new.

Title: Burkley Prescott Folio iPad Case review: Magnetic and detachable
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Premium leather defines this luxurious two-in-one case. Use shell case alone, and attach it magnetically to the folio stand when needed.

Title: Nintendo Switch 2019 Review: An improved hybrid experience
Author: Russell Holly
Description: We got our hands on the new Nintendo Switch with longer battery life and tested it out for over 30 hours to see how it compares to the original. Though some of the differences are slight, it's definitely a better system than the original.
Bottom Line: This newer version of the Switch allows you to play your favorite Switch games for longer stretches. It has a battery life of 4.5 to 9 hours and can be used to play on TV or in your hands like a handheld gaming system. This is definitely an improved model from the original and makes for a great gaming system.

Title: Satechi Dual Smart Outlet review: Double the smarts with separate controls
Author: Lory Gil
Description: Dual smart outlets are awesome but having separate controls for each is invaluable.

Title: Satechi Bluetooth keyboard for Mac review: A whole lot of good for $80
Author: Luke Filipowicz
Description: For all the accessories you can buy for your Mac, MacBook, or iPad Pro, there's probably no accessory you would use more than a great keyboard. Can the Satechi Bluetooth keyboard for Mac stand out enough to be worth $80? Read my full review to find out.

Title: ESR Paper-Like Screen Protector review: Closer to pen on paper
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: The ESR Paper-Like Screen Protector delivers on its promises: writing or drawing on your iPad with your finger or stylus does indeed have a more paper-like feel. But there is definitely a compromise to be made.
Bottom Line: : $25 for two

Title: Journey on iOS review: It's about the voyage, not the destination
Author: Christine Chan
Description: Journey, the classic adventure game that is beloved by many, has surprisingly arrived on iPhone and iPad. Is it worth checking out?
Bottom Line: Journey is a beautiful, peaceful, and tranquil platforming adventure game that demonstrates that it's all about the trek to get to your destination, rather than the destination itself.

Title: AirSnap review: The best case for your AirPods — now with twill!
Author: Lory Gil
Description: My favorite AirPods case looks even cuter with this new outfit.

Title: Nimble iPhone Case review: An eco-friendly choice
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Nimble cases are made from recycled water bottles, and 5% of the proceeds are donated to various organizations working to save our oceans. Plus, it's a nice case.

Title: QiStone 2 Review: Backup power three ways
Author: Russell Holly
Description: It's a weird little battery, for sure. But if you have a lot of different things to charge, this is a surprisingly capable option to have.

Title: Osprey Nova Backpack review: Laptop bag and much more
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: I'd been looking for a larger laptop backpack with separate compartments for my MacBook Pro, iPad Pro, and other necessities. I've found it in the Osprey Nova.

Title: Fire Emblem: Three Houses for Nintendo Switch review: A fun tactical game at a medieval Hogwarts
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: I spent over 30 hours testing the newest game in the Fire Emblem franchise. It's a bit complex to get used to, but once you've gotten a hang of everything you'll find it provides a rewarding strategy game in a Hogwarts-like environment.
Bottom Line: There is a lot to this game, so much so that it can feel incredibly overwhelming when learning how to play. However, after you learn the basics, this game doesn't feel so daunting. Everything comes together to create a fun strategy game that not only has a fun plot but allows you to influence the outcomes with your decisions.

Title: Costco Photo Printing review: Good prices for members only
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Costco offers a nice selection of photo print sizes, photo products, and other print services worth checking out. The quality is great and the prices are reasonable.
Bottom Line: : Varies

Title: CVS Photo Printing review: Extensive photo services
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: CVS offers an impressive array of photo services, but I had a significant issue with the photo book I ordered.
Bottom Line: : Varies

Title: Aura Digital Photo Frame Review: I can't stop using it
Author: Jared DiPane
Description: The Aura digital photo frame has captured the heart of myself and my wife, and if you give it a shot I bet you'll love it too!

Title: Nations Photo Lab Photo Printing review: Quality and variety rules
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Nations Photo Lab offers a huge variety of stellar quality photos and photo products. You'll have to deal with an annoying photo book platform, however.
Bottom Line: : Varies

Title: Astro Bears for Nintendo Switch review: A stellar party game for up to four players
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: Compete with friends using adorable cartoony bear characters in this 3D version of Snake.
Bottom Line: This inexpensive game provides hilarious entertainment with a simple base idea. It's the perfect party games since it's lighthearted, funny, supports up to four players, provides just the right amount of strategy, features multiple modes, and is riddled with hilarious bear puns.

Title: Coros Vertix review: There's new competition for the big-dog fitness trackers in town
Author: Mathias Eichler
Description: Long-distance runners need reliability they can trust. So what happens when a company you trust suffers reliability? Coros is here to pick up the pieces.

Title: FreePrints Photo Printing review: Different, easy, and fun
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: FreePrints online photo printing service is utterly unlike the others out there. It has an interesting model that offers tons of "free" products each month.
Bottom Line: : Varies

Title: Mixbook Photo Printing review: Focus on quality
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Mixbook focuses on making a few products very well rather than making a ton of different photo products. The site can be confusing and prices aren't the cheapest, but deals and promo codes are plentiful.
Bottom Line: : Varies

Title: Suunto 9 review: A wilderness runner's best performance-tracking friend
Author: Mathias Eichler
Description: When you're long-distance running through the woods, the last thing you want to do is slow down to look at your fitness tracker's tiny screen.
Bottom Line: From $600

Title: AdoramaPix Photo Printing review: Outstanding quality
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: AdoramaPix focuses on prints, wall art, photo books, cards, and calendars and does them exceedingly well. The quality is a cut above.
Bottom Line: : Varies

Title: Walgreens Photo Printing review: Great all around
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Walgreens offers a wide range of photo printing services. I can easily recommend Walgreens photo printing for just about everyone.
Bottom Line: : Varies

Title: Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3: The Black Order for Nintendo Switch review: Enjoyable romp through the Marvel universe
Author: Rebecca Spear
Description: Fight with favorite Marvel characters to defeat Thanos and his followers in this cartoonish, entertaining romp through the comics universe.
Bottom Line: This game offers a fun way for up to four friends to engage in multiplayer co-op with a full fledged story line and a roster of characters, although technical issues bring down the experience.

Title: Twelve South StayGo review: A multi-port hub designed for mobility
Author: Lory Gil
Description: Every time I take my MacBook Pro on the road, I have to bring a half-dozen devices to plug into it. I need ultimate portability.

Title: Snapfish Photo Printing review: All-around great photo service
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Snapfish offers free and unlimited photo storage, a huge selection of photo prints and other photo items, great quality, easy ordering, and reasonable prices.
Bottom Line: : Varies

Title: Mpix Photo Printing review: Beautiful photos and more
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: I loved the photos I received from Mpix, and their packaging was totally extra. But placing my order on their website was a chore.
Bottom Line: : Varies

Title: Vizio P Series (2019) PX65-G1 Review — almost an OLED
Author: Nirave Gondhia
Description: Vizio's best TV leaves a lasting impression thanks to hundreds of local dimming zones, a super wide color spectrum and support for every smart home system. You'll need a streaming media device plugged in, but this is a great smart TV.

Title: One Drop Chrome review: Managing diabetes done right
Author: Christine Chan
Description: Having diabetes is no fun, believe me. But this beautiful blood glucose monitor helps make managing it a bit better.

Title: Amazon Photo Printing review: Fantastic storage, great prints
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: Amazon offers unlimited free full-resolution photo storage plus 5GB of free video storage to Prime members. Amazon also has a reasonably priced photo printing service worth checking out.
Bottom Line: : varies

Title: iPadOS Preview: Desktop-class Safari, Download Manager, and more!
Author: Rene Ritchie
Description: Apple is calling it Desktop Class Safari for iPad. The full-on web finally optimized for iPad or the iPad finally fully optimized for the web. And it’s coming with iPadOS this fall and, a fair amount of it, with iOS 13 for iPhone as well.

Title: iPad is the new Mac display: Sidecar Explained
Author: Rene Ritchie
Description: Sidecar is exactly that Continuity Display feature many of us have been wanting for a while now. But it's also a whole lot more.

Title: Eufy Video Doorbell Review: No strings attached
Author: Christopher Close
Description: Everything great about video doorbells, without the high price and subscription.

Title: The End of iTunes: Apple's New Mac Media Strategy Explained
Author: Rene Ritchie
Description: Apple isn't really killing iTunes as much as setting it free.

Title: iPadOS Preview: Files app, USB Storage, SMB Shares
Author: Rene Ritchie
Description: With iPadOS — and, yes, an iPhone and even an iPod touch running iOS 13 — you can finally access external files, not just photos, not just videos, but honest-to-Unix external documents, assets, and anything else, just by plugging in a USB drive, stick, even SD or Compact Flash card.

Title: Mophie powerstation hub review: Travel charging with no extra cables necessary
Author: Lory Gil
Description: When you take your gadgets on the road, you can charge them all at once without even needing an extra cable in your bag.

Title: Adonit Note Stylus review: Sophisticated design
Author: Karen S Freeman
Description: This expensive-looking but reasonably-priced stylus is rich in features. It feels as close to using a pen on paper as you can get with a stylus on an iPad.
